title: Implement caching layer (TTL cache) for FastAPI services
description: Port TTL cache from ~/git/mcp/core/cache.py to FastAPI. Provides disk-persistent caching with LRU eviction. Useful for YouTube transcripts and future services. Consider using FastAPI dependency injection for cache instance.

title: Add comprehensive error handling and logging
close_reason: Added comprehensive error handling with custom exception classes (APIError, AuthenticationError, RateLimitExceeded), structured logging with configurable log levels, and exception handlers in app/main.py

title: Setup SQLite database with API key storage
Create MCP server to expose FastAPI tools
description: Create MCP server wrapper around FastAPI endpoints. The MCP server will expose FastAPI tools to LLMs. Similar to ~/git/mcp/server.py but pointing to FastAPI backend instead of direct implementation. Consider whether to include caching/rate limiting in MCP layer or rely on FastAPI layer.

title: Create documentation (API docs, setup guide)
close_reason: Created comprehensive README.md with quick start guide, API usage examples, configuration docs, Docker deployment, project structure, development setup, and security best practices

title: Implement YouTube transcript service endpoint
description: Migrate YouTube transcript service from ~/git/mcp to FastAPI. Core functionality includes: get_transcript (with multiple format support: plain, structured, srt, vtt), list_transcript_languages, video ID extraction, proxy/cookies support, comprehensive error handling. Reuse existing core logic from tools/youtube_transcript.py

title: Setup separate MCP service in docker-compose
description: Add MCP server as separate service in docker-compose.yml. MCP wraps FastAPI endpoints via HTTP calls. Configure networking between services. MCP exposes tools for LLMs while FastAPI handles all business logic.

title: Setup Docker Compose configuration for FastAPI
Setup Python 3.13 development environment with venv
Create dedicated API key for MCP server authentication
description: Generate and configure a dedicated API key for MCP server to authenticate with FastAPI backend. Document in .env.example as MCP_API_KEY. MCP server will use this key in all requests to FastAPI.
close_reason: MCP_API_KEY placeholder added to .env.example and config.py. Setup instructions documented in README. Key generation available via scripts/manage_keys.py. Full automation deferred to Phase 4 MCP integration.

comments.author: claus
comments.text: MCP_API_KEY placeholder added to .env.example. To generate the key, run: python scripts/manage_keys.py create mcp-server --tier admin --description 'MCP server authentication key' and save the generated key to MCP_API_KEY in .env. This will be automated when MCP server integration is implemented.

title: Setup .env configuration and environment management
description: Create .env.example with all config options (MASTER_API_KEY, database settings, cache settings, rate limits, YouTube proxy/cookies). Use pydantic-settings for type-safe config loading. Document all environment variables.

title: Implement rate limiting for API endpoints
description: Port rate limiter from ~/git/mcp/core/rate_limit.py or use FastAPI rate limiting libraries (slowapi, fastapi-limiter). Should work with API key authentication to track limits per key. Sliding window approach.

title: Add RESTful API endpoints for YouTube transcript service
description: Create REST endpoints: GET /api/v1/youtube/transcript/{video_id}, GET /api/v1/youtube/{video_id}/languages. Include query params for languages, format, caching options. Follow OpenAPI/FastAPI best practices.
